page.title: 03Nuneham Courtenay:Gen.Survey
page.content: Population 176, in 80 households, N.C. sits astride the A423 trunk road. It is a dormitory village with little work and minimal social activity. A Civil Parish only, the Eccl. Parish was amal- gamated with the Baldons in 1970. The Church is used as a store. In 1760 Lord Harcourt moved his Estate cottages to their present site by the road, from their positions in the grounds of Nuneham House. They are now listed buildings. N.C. has a garage, (fuel, car sales and service,) an Inn, (Harcourt Arms,) a Cobblers, a P.O. with Gen. Stores, an embroidery shop, a blacksmith, (on the site of the old School,) a Garden Centre with Tea Room, and a scrap metal yard. A wooden Village Hall is used by a few local organisations,(e.g. W.I.) Nuneham House is a Conference Centre.
